title.narrative: Strategic Sector Cooperation on water between Denmark and China, Phase II

description.narrative: A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phas-es; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon. Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.

Strategic Sector Cooperation on water between Denmark and China, Phase II
The main objective is to improve wastewater management in China. It is envisaged that the project and the budget will be expanded with a component focusing on improved groundwater management, which will assist the Chinese Ministry of Water Resources in securing a sustainable water supply.
This project addresses the need for improving water quality of rivers, streams and lakes in rural areas. Focus will be on strengthening wastewater management through a combination of eco-restoration measures and efficient treatment of wastewater discharges from house-holds and industries. The cooperation will gain experiences from demonstration projects implemented in the provinces involved in the project, hereby providing input for policy development.
